result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. Through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  To make regular monthly payments.  To serve 10 days in HOC, consecutive if not paid in full.

Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving two years of Initial Confinement in this case.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment, school or a combination of both.

No alcohl or controlled substance without a valid prescription.
No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular payments.
AODA assessment.  Satisfactorily complete with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests at least once per month.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting righs are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civl rights are restored.

Decision And Order Denying Motion For Plea Withdrawal signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Received and filed, transcript of guilty plea hearing.
Request for guilty plea transcript made to court reporter.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for plea withdrawal dur to ineffective assistance of counsel.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (61 pages) commencing AUGUST 16, 2014 received and filed.
Letters for sentencing, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Father, Wesley E.-B.; Sister, Kendra G.; Grandmother, Karen S.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, (after serving 2 years of intial confinement in THIS case), and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- AODA assessment and satisfactorily complete with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, at least once per month.
- Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant to serve 10 days in HOC, consecutive if not paid in full.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in court with attorney Michael G Levine.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for oral ruling.  Attorney Levine wrote a letter to the court stating there was no standing, and defendant wants to resolve the case.  Court proceeds with the plea hearing.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/15/2014, at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Court orders defendant to be produced for the next court date.  Court orders a PSI.  PSI order signed and filed. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Letter from attorney Levine, stating he will not be filing any additional brief in this case, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel informed the court that defendant does not wish to have a motion hearing, and wants to resolve the case.  Court held colloquy with the defendant on his right to give up his right to a motion heairng.  
Plea hearing proceeded.  Court finds there is not a factual basis to accept the defendant's plea.  

Court proceeds with motion hearing.  State brings up the issue of standing.  Defense counsel requests time to brief the issue.  Court orders defense to file a brief by 5/8/2014.  State to respond by 5/26/2014.  Defense to file any response by 6/2/2014.  Case adjourned for oral ruling on 6/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.  aw  Oral ruling scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's response to motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Michael Levine in court, defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a motion.  State to respond by 3/28/2014.  Case adjourned for DISPOSITIVE motion hearing on 4/10/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Motion hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw
Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING (24 pages) commencing JANUARY 27, 2014  received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in court with attorney Michael Levine.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 2/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in court with attorney Michael Levine.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF3681 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Matthew Dresen-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in court with attorney Michael Levine.  Defendant Kenneth Lamar Graham in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
